Hell, it ain't about just the ballgame, Doc. You gotta understand. It's about... well, it's about showin' that ol' Big Nurse she ain't the queen bee around here. She's got this whole ward wrapped around her little finger, makin' grown men feel like whipped puppies. The schedule? The rules? They're all just ways to keep us pinned down, to keep us from rememberin' we're men. I saw a flicker in their eyes, you see? A little spark when I brought up the game. It was a chance, a little crack in that wall she's built. For a second there, they weren't just patients... they were guys who wanted to watch a ballgame. Win or lose, it was about takin' a swing. It's the first rule of a card game, you know? You gotta play the hand you're dealt. And I was dealin' us a chance to feel alive again, even if it was just for nine innings. That's worth more than any damn schedule.
